H0.text: The distance light travels in one year is what a light year refers to.

H1.text: The light year refers to the distance light travels in one year.

H2.text: The amount of light required on Earth in one year is what a “light year” refers to.

H3.text: The distance between two sources of light is what a “light year” refers to.

A4.text: As defined by the International Astronomical Union (IAU), a light-year is the distance that light travels in vacuum in one Julian year (365.25 days).

A5.text: Despite its inclusion of the word 'year', the term should not be misinterpreted as a unit of time.
